data.name: Morin Khuur
data.description: A traditional horsehead fiddle with two strings, representing a horse's head and body.

data.name: Yatga
data.description: A traditional zither-like instrument with strings that are plucked.

data.name: Tovshuur
data.description: A two-stringed lute with a long neck, often played in traditional Mongolian music.

data.name: Shanz
data.description: A long-necked, three-stringed lute with a trapezoidal soundbox.

data.name: Byzaanchy
data.description: A wind instrument made from a sheep's rib bones, producing a haunting sound.

data.name: Limbe
data.description: A flute-like instrument made from bamboo, often used in Mongolian folk music.

data.name: Khuuchir
data.description: A jew's harp-like instrument made from metal or bamboo, producing a twanging sound.

data.name: Yoochir
data.description: A hammered dulcimer with metal strings that are struck with mallets.

data.name: Topshur
data.description: A long-necked, two-stringed lute with a resonating body, used in traditional Mongolian music.

data.name: Khoomei Singer
data.description: A throat singer who produces unique overtone and undertone vocalizations using traditional Mongolian techniques.

data.name: Shudraga
data.description: A bowed string instrument with a small soundbox, often used in Mongolian folk music.

data.name: Igil
data.description: A two-stringed bowed instrument with a deep, resonant tone, used in Mongolian and Tuvan music.

params.name: Name of the musical instrument
params.description: Brief description of the instrument and its characteristics
params.timePeriod: Historical or cultural time period associated with the instrument
params.materials: Materials used in the construction of the instrument
params.images: URLs of images depicting the instrument
